rComments: Dr. Gould is one of the best professors I have ever had in University. She gives amazing feedback on your papers. However her classes require ALOT of reading and is def not easy.

Easily one of my favorite teachers. You did have to put in some work but the feeling you get after each class is undescribable. If you get the chance to take her do it!!! The more effort you put in the more you'll get out of the class. Her classes aren't an easy A but they're in no doubt passable, it isn't inpossible!:)had her for 105A as well

I really enjoyed her class, sadly I was completely clueless about the subject so I had a tough time but she was really helpful and understanding. She is tough on your grade, she expects you to analyze and your writing skills must be good! No test just 2 papers and 5 reading responses. BTW LOTS of reading but they were all interesting! NOT an easy A

Professor Gould is one of the best teachers i have had my entire school life, i was able to understand everything she was saying, she really took time during lecture explaining a concept, until you knew the subject. If you go to class and really listen to what she says you will do fine in class
debbie is an incredible teacher! teaches you to think critically. loved this class

Good and knowledgeable teacher. Passionate about the subject, her lectures go over the readings and make them more understandable. Had her for soc 10, she didnt take attendance but gave a EASY pop quiz like three times, just to give the credit to the people who actually went. TAs graded our papers so cant really talk about that.

Debbie is such a wonderful professor. She's clear, helpful, understanding, and extremely encouraging. I'm so happy to have taken this Rise of Capitalism course with her! She honestly cares about her students and makes sure everyone understands the material. Extensive feedback given from writing assignments that is extremely helpful. Thanks Debbie!

I had her for the Rise of Capitalism and it's consequences. She's terrible, cut me off every other sentence and only assigned essays when I had midterms or finals.Possibly more pertinent due to the small discussion nature of the class itself but I went in obsessed about the subject and left regretting the class.  AVOID!!!!!  do yourself a favour

Debbie is one of the greatest professors I have ever had.  I had her for SOCY10 and 177 (social movements) and absolutely loved her both times.  She makes the material easy to understand and both classes were wonderful.  Lots of reading but her classes are really worth it (I got A's in both).

Gould is an amazing professor!! She is a great discussion leader and she will inspire you to think critically & analytically. She has very interesting knowledge from her field experience. The reading can be a bit much (but interesting) and there are only 4 homework assignments (periodically) and an in-class midterm and final (essay style).

Took 10 with Gould and was excited to be back for this course! Gould is an amazing lecturer and passionate about her field. I have nothing for respect for this woman. She expects some effort and analytic thought, so be prepared to actually work like a college student, it'll make you better for it.
Debbie was a great professor and was incredibly insightful! Take this class!!!!!!

Amazing how knowledgable, clear, humble, and open to ideas one person can hold and be. Truly an intellectually stimulating course. This course made me think critically and question ideas/events I wouldn't have normally. Deb definitely made the material fun and exciting :)

SOCY 10 with Deborah Gould has been one of the most rewarding experiences I've had as a student. She is amazing at teaching the subject matter by engaging with the text and truly challenges you to think critically. I appreciated how humble, kind, and approachable she was. She was also great at allowing ideas to circulate during lecture.
Honestly the best class that I have taken so far at UCSC. Learned a lot from this class and Prof. Gould made it very interesting and fun. Definitely recommend this class and Prof.
